Content: @jl777c just tried the https://github.com/artemii235/SuperNET/releases/tag/v1.0.536 build but it gives me the same issue

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: gtc orders fail with -9999 (unmatched) if the don't get matched in the first request

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: ahhh

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: ok

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: let me wait a few more mins to check

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: is there any way we can change that so it doesn't respond with the error?

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: I think it's a unintuitive to respond with an unmatched error for an order id

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: if the same id will then be matched later on

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: there's no way to differentiate in the UI between an order that will never match and an order that won't match for the next five minutes

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: currently it will appear in our UI as pending, then failed/unmatched, and then at some point in the future magically match and start swapping

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: which is not at all intuitive to users, they may well think it's failed and re-issue the order

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: I think it would make more sense to suppress the unmatched event for gtc ordrs

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: so they just see it as pending until it matches

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, i will try to suppress it for gtc:1 orders

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: awesome, thanks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: pushed fix, will propagate it to artem's branch in about an hour
